definitions: To deposit money or valuables in a bank.
To operate a bank or work in a bank.
To rely on or count on something.
To tilt an aircraft or vehicle sideways when turning.
To form into a bank or mound.
examples: I need to bank this check.
He banks with a local credit union.
You can bank on her support.
The pilot banked the plane sharply.
Snow banked up against the fence.
